etymology.description: 号(hào ‘mark; number’) + 码(mǎ ‘numeral; code’) = assigned number/code.
etymology.interpretation: Combines the idea of a mark/identifier (号) with a coded symbol (码) to denote an assigned number or code. Common for phone numbers, serials, room numbers, and other identifiers.
etymology.simplification: Traditional 號碼 was simplified to 号码 in Mainland China: 號 → 号 via a reduced-stroke cursive-derived form; 碼 → 码 by simplifying 馬 to 马 and regularizing the left component, lowering stroke count.

examples.chinese: 请把你的电话号码告诉我(請把你的電話號碼告訴我)。
examples.pinyin: Qǐng bǎ nǐ de diànhuà hàomǎ gàosu wǒ.
examples.english: Please tell me your phone number.

examples.chinese: 这个包裹的快递单上有追踪号码(這個包裹的快遞單上有追蹤號碼)。
examples.pinyin: Zhège bāoguǒ de kuàidìdān shàng yǒu zhuīzōng hàomǎ.
examples.english: There is a tracking number on the courier slip for this package.

examples.chinese: 每张票都有唯一的号码(每張票都有唯一的號碼)。
examples.pinyin: Měi zhāng piào dōu yǒu wéiyī de hàomǎ.
examples.english: Each ticket has a unique number.
